rules.name: Heading Space Compatibility
rules.description: Always put a space between the hash signs (#) and the heading name for compatibility, as Markdown applications do not all agree on handling missing spaces.

rules.name: Step Atomicity
rules.description: Avoid defining multiple actions in a single numbered step. Steps must be split to ensure the instructional guide is easy to understand and follow.

expected.rule: Each numbered step must contain a single, atomic action.

invalid: 1. Open Chrome browser and navigate to the Wiz console.

rules.name: Wait Time Clarity
rules.description: Wait times after a step must be clearly called out using explicit durations, avoiding ambiguous statements.

expected.rule: Wait times must be quantified (e.g., '5 minutes').

valid: Correct: This step will take around 5 minutes to complete.
invalid: Incorrect: This step will take some time to get completed.

rules.name: Non-Action Content Placement
rules.description: Information that is not an active step should be structured as a note or info using elements like blockquotes, not as a numbered step.

expected.rule: Use notes or blockquotes (>) for informational content.

valid: > Note: Document what you learn for future reference.
invalid: 6. If you are providing information, do not add it as a step.

rules.name: Structured Heading Hierarchy
rules.description: Avoid undefined headings after which numbering restarts to maintain a coherent, logical flow (Task 1 must be followed by Task 1.1, etc.).

expected.rule: Use sequential task/subtask numbering (e.g., Task 1 followed by Task 1.1).

rules.name: Blockquote Separation
rules.description: Provide a blank line before and after a blockquote to ensure Markdown exits the element, preventing subsequent lines from being included incorrectly.

expected.rule: Blockquote content must be wrapped by blank lines.

valid:
Accepted: Put a blank line before...

> This is a blockquote

...and after a blockquote.
invalid: Not Accepted: Put a blank line before...\n> This is a blockquote\n>...and after a blockquote.

rules.name: Personalized Inject Key Usage
rules.description: Use the custom 'inject keys' feature for inserting dynamic, personalized information (like account IDs, usernames, or passwords) instead of deprecated placeholders like UniqueID.
rules.requires_spec_section: Injecting Personalized Information into a Guide

rules.name: Local Image Pathing
rules.description: Images referenced via a local path (such as GitHub) must be placed in a separate folder, typically using the relative path structure './images/'.

rules.name: Image Bracket Spacing
rules.description: Do not include any space immediately following the closing square bracket of the image description, as this can break rendering or compatibility.
